For scrambling cubes, you always need to have the green face facing you and the white face above. Here are the meaning of each notations used : 

R, L, F, B, U, D indicates which face to turn : 
R : Right face. 
L : Left face. 
F : Front face. 
B : Back face. 
U : Up face. 
D : Down face. 

2, ' indicates how to turn them : 
an alone letter means to do a clockwise quarter turn. 
' means to do a counterclockwise quarter turn. 
2 means to do a half turn. 

So, for example L' means to do a quarter turn counterclockwise of the left face.

For scrambling big cubes like 4x4 and 5x5, it\'s the same as 2x2 or 3x3 but single letters means to turn the external layer, and when the letter is followed by a w, you have have to turn both external and internal layer of the face. \n\nSo, for example Fw2 means to do a half turn of both front layers.

For scrambling big cubes like 6x6 and 7x7, it\'s the same as 4x4 or 5x5 but letters followed by a w and preceded by a 3 means to turn the 3 external layers. \n\nSo, for example 3Uw\' means to do a quarter turn counterclockwise of the 3 up layers.

For scrambling square-1, you always need to have the 2 'bars' horizontal in order to have a small piece at the left of the middle layer of the front face. 

Then, a / means to do half a turn of the right block, this move is called 'slice'. between the 2 parentheses, there is 2 numbers : 
- The first one is the number of 30° clockwise turns of the top face. 
- The second one is the number of 30° clockwise turns of the down face. 
So a negative number means to turn counterclockwise. 

For example, (3,-1) / means to turn the top face 90° (a quarter turn) clockwise and the down face 30° counterclockwise. Then, do a slice.

For scrambling skewb, you always need to take it with the white-green-red corner facing you, in order to have white face above, green face left and red face right. 
Here are the meaning of each notations used : 

R, L, B, U indicates which angle to turn, 
R : Lower right corner (blue-red-yellow). 
L : Lower left corner (orange-green-yellow). 
B : Back corner (blue-orange-yellow). 
U : Up corner (white-orange-blue). 

If the letter is alone, you have to do the turn clockwise, if it's followed by ', you have to do the turn counterclockwise. 

So, for example L' means to turn the lower left corner counterclockwise.

For scrambling pyraminx, you always need to take it with the yellow face on bottom and green face facing you. 
Here are the meaning of each notations used : 

R, L, B, U indicates which tip to turn : 
R : Right tip. 
L : Left tip. 
B : Back tip. 
U : Up tip. 

If the letter is alone, you have to do the turn clockwise, if it's followed by ', you have to do the turn counterclockwise. 
If the letter is upercase, you have to turn both layer of the tip, 
If the letter is lowercase, you only have to turn the external little tip,


So, for example R means to turn the both layers of the right tip clockwise.

For scrambling megaminx, you always need to take it with the green face facing you and the white face as top face. 
For the notation, you have to take the 3 pieces (corner-edge-corner) on the left of white face, generally they contains white and purple. 
Here are the meaning of each notations used : 

R++ means to lock your 3 pieces and turn all the Right block clockwise 2 times (144°) 
R-- : same but counterclockwise (-144°) 
D++ means to lock your 3 pieces and turn all the Bottom block clockwise 2 times (144°) 
D-- : same but counterclockwise (-144°) 
U : release your 3 pieces, turn the white face clockwise (72°) and relock the 3 left pieces 
U' : release your 3 pieces, turn the white face counterclockwise (-72°) and relock the 3 left pieces


So, for example D-- means to turn everything counterclockwise (-144°) without the top face
No scramble available for this event.

This app it's just a timer for speedcubers to time themselves, register there times, calculate there averages, records... 

Some explanations about the app : 
-You can choose your event by clicking on the event name in the top bar. 
-You can add a personal event by clicking on 'add event' in unofficial part. 
-You can edit a personal event by a long click on it in the eventList. 
-OH means to solve the cube with only one hand. 
-BLD means to solve the cube blindfolded. 
-FT means to only solve the cube using feet. 

-You can set penalty to a time by clicking on it in the time list. 
-You can remove a time by clicking on it in the time list and press 'delete time'. 
-AvgX means 'average' and it's the average of x times without the best and the worst time of the concerned list of times. 
-MoX means 'mean of' and it's the average of x times counting the best and the worst time. 

-In chart, blue times are times without penalty. 
-red times are times with a DNF penalty. 
-green times are times with a +2 penalty. 

If still things that you don't understand, don't hesitate to send a message to the developer in 'contact', he is responsive and he can update the app to do it better!

resources.string: This time was added manually, the scramble is unavailable.
The timer precision is boosted to milliseconds.
You can change the timer background color in settings.
The biggest cube ever constructed is a 22x22x22.
The official world record for solving a 3x3x3 cube is 4.78s by Mats Valk!
The 2017 world rubik\'s cube championship will take place in Paris.
The rubik\'s cube has 43 252 003 274 489 856 000 different possible combinations.
The 7x7x7 cube has more different possible combinations than the number of atomes in the universe.
The mirror block unofficial world record is 9.57s.
All scrambles of the rubik\'s cube can be solve in 20 moves or less.
